PLN Capital Expenditure for new coal plants (government finance, loans & guarantees)
PLN capex figures reported in media

2008-09: total capex from central government, 38% for 2007-09 and 26% went to energy (World Bank, Indonesia Economic Quarterly, March 2013); 2010: 55% of PLN capex goes to FTP, 80% forcoal; 2011-2012(82% of newly built capacity is coal). GOI provides funding and loan guarantees for new coal power plants-PLN capex for expansion is assumed to capture this activitiy.
IIGF guarantee,Central Java coal fired power plant (2000 MW)

GOI announced starting in 2014 IUP holders and renegotiated COW/CCOWs will all pay 13.5 percent royalty rate (which it was prior to 2009). GOI estimates an additional Rp 4 trillion ($408.2 million).  2012/2013 subsidy based on this GOI estimate adjusted back to 2009 based on coal production figures.
Lost tax revenue from illegal coal mining
Government of Indonesia, Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources
GOIestimates the illegal coal mining represents $460 million of lost tax revenue.Subsidy based on GOI estimate for 2012/2013 adjusted back to 2006 based on coal production figures.
Power line and grid infrastructure to serve coal power plants
Coal rail line infrastructure to serve coal production
Under-pricing of access to gov land

Law Number 19/2003 on SOEs: the Government is obliged to provide a subsidy to PLN for the difference between the price charged for electricity and the cost to provide electricity.  In 2012, this subsidy cost $9.5 billion.  This subsidy chiefly goes to address the gap in consumer prices and costs for oil.  The IMF and World Bank have focused on consumer subsidy reforms and have assisted the GOI in raising tariffs with targets to protect the poor.

DOE Loan Guarantee for Advanced Coal Projects
DOE 2013 solicitation (no money had been given out before then even though there was a previous solicitation in 2008)

This is for advanced fossil fuel projects, but most illustrative types of eligible projects are coal, and $6 billion allocated for Coal-based Power Generation and Industrial Gasification and $2 billion for Advanced Coal Gasification (and 2013 solicitation expanded eligible projects a lot to include full life-cycle of fossil energy development. Loan guarantee is $8 billion, subsidy figure assumes 1% risk to government
